title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - C.24 (Iraq War3)
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 24 (Iraq War 3):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Ahmad - The Road to Iraq; the Making of a Neoconservative War (2014)

-  Bert - American Military Intervention in Unconventional War; from the Philippines to Iraq (2011)

-  Blum - America's Deadliest Export, Democracy; the Truth About U.S. Foreign Policy and Everything Else (2013)

-  Bodansky - The Secret History of the Iraq War (2004)

-  Bogdanos & Patrick - Thieves of Baghdad; One Marine's Passion to Recover the World's Greatest Stolen Treasures (2005)

-  Bolger - Why We Lost; a General's Inside Account of the Iraq and Afghanistan Wars (2014)

-  Bruneau - Patriots for Profit; Contractors and the Military in U.S. National Security (2011)

-  Buley - The New American Way of War; Military Culture and the Political Utility of Force (2008)

-  Campbell - Desert War; the New Conflict between the U.S. and Iraq (2003)

-  Cerf & Navasky - Mission Accomplished; or How We Won the War in Iraq (2008)

-  Chandrasekaran - Imperial Life in the Emerald City; Inside Iraq's Green Zone (2006)

-  Cooley - An Alliance Against Babylon; the US, Israel and Iraq (2005)

-  Dadge - The War in Iraq and Why the Media Failed Us (2006)

-  Davies - Blood on Our Hands; the American Invasion and Destruction of Iraq (2010)

-  Davis - Presidential Policies and the Road to the Second Iraq War; from Forty One to Forty Three (2006)

-  Engel (Eds.) - Into the Desert; Reflection on the Gulf War (2013)

-  Harvey - Explaining the Iraq War; Counterfactual Theory Logic and Evidence (2012)

-  HRW - Violent Response; the US Army in Al-Falluja (2003)

-  Kinsey & Patterson (Eds.) - Contractors & War; the Transformation of US Expeditionary Operations (2012)

-  Lewis - 935 Lies; the Future of Truth and the Decline of America's Moral Integrity (2014)

-  Malone - The International Struggle Over Iraq; Politics in the UN Security Council, 1980-2005 (2006)

-  Martin - The Iraqi Prisoners Abuse Scandal  (2005)

-  Mowle (Ed.) - Hope Is Not a Plan; the War in Iraq from Inside the Green Zone (2007)

-  Packer - The Assassins' Gate; America in Iraq (2005)

-  Pearson - The Search for Iraq's Weapons of Mass Destruction; Inspection, Verification and Non-Proliferation (2005)

-  Pillar - Intelligence and U.S. Foreign Policy; Iraq, 9-11, and Misguided Reform (2011)

-  Rampton & Stauber - Weapons of Mass Deception; the Uses of Propaganda in Bush's War on Iraq (2003)

-  Roussel & Lechauxm - Voicing Dissent; American Artists and the War on Iraq (2010)

-  Rutherford - Weapons of Mass Persuasion; Marketing the War against Iraq (2004)

-  Schumacher - A Bloody Business; America's War Zone Contractors and the Occupation of Iraq (2010)

-  Tracy - I am Sorry for Your Loss, and I Wish You Well in a Free Iraq; Compensating Civilian Causalities (Nov. 2008)

-  Unger - Boss Rove; Inside Karl Rove's Secret Kingdom of Power (2012)

-  Warren - No Place to Hide; a Brain Surgeon's Long Journey Home from the Iraq War (2014)

-  Wolfe - Winning the War of Words; Selling the War on Terror from Afghanistan to Iraq (2008)

-  Zinsmeister - Dawn Over Baghdad; How the U.S. Military Is Using Bullets and Ballots to Remake Iraq (2004)
